Description: Body sherd of East Greek black-figured pottery amphora or oinochoe. Outside: part of head, breast, right foot and wing of sphinx, probably seated, to right, with added red. Inside reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 5, N 14)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 43, no. D. 1)
CVA Musée Scheurleer II (Hague) / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Pays-Bas Musée Scheurleer (II D et III C, p. 5, pl. II, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.035)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2914 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
